newsitem.title: UK: Carclo down following downbeat statement.
newsitem.headline: Carclo down following downbeat statement.

text.p: Shares in Britain's Carclo Engineering Group Plc fell sharply on Monday after the company announced a drop in first-half pre-tax profits along with a downbeat statement.
The shares were down 48-1/2p at 202-1/2p by 1323 GMT, though no trading was recorded.
The company posted a decline in pre-tax profits for the half-year ended 30 September to 74 million stg compared with 76 million for the same period last year.
"Competetive pressures remain strong and, as yet, there is no sign of a sustained recovery in order intake across the group," said Carclo chairman John Ewart.
The statement said profits in the company's Lee Steel Strip unit had fallen by 68 percent, overshadowing good progress in its card clothing and general engineering divisions.
Ewart blamed falling stainless steel prices and reduced exports to Europe as a result of "recessionary conditions", and delays in the commisioning of a new mill.
"The poor performance of Lee Steel Strip is likely to have a major adverse impact on the result for the year, masking the progress that has been made in other divisions," said Ewart.
